comments: mylene priam is awesome. this class was a nice break from lecture and had little outside work.
It's an interesting class if it's something that you're interested in.  If not, don't waste your time because you'll be bored.
It is definitely a good adn relaxed introduction to postcolonialism as a whole. It is not as rigorous as certaind epartmental courses but works very well as a Freshman seminar.

This is a really interesting class to take. The readings can be eye-opening, and Professor Priam can provide a great perspective. She's really enthusiastic and warm, and generates a really good class environment. Note that fairly strong French listening skills are probably required (though you can talk or write in English if you like).
This seminar was fantastic, and Prof. Priam is an amazing teacher. It really changed the way I think about the world.

Mylene is a wonderful teacher! She leads and encourages discussions and creates passion in students for her class. The readings are very exciting, and, if you have good knowledge of French, I definitely recommend taking this class! If you end up taking it (I hope you do because you won't regret it!), make the most out of it! This is a very exciting Freshman Seminar!
This is by far the best course that I will ever take at Harvard. It changed the way that I looked at myself and the way that I look at the world.

Take a trip throughout history, culture, and the human consciousness, as you learn how it could be possible to build on the ashes left by colonialism in Africa and the Caribbean. It's super fun and pretty low key, and yet you find yourself wanting to do your best work!
